answers.answer: Hello,Thank you for your question. Was that blood sugar test done with you fasting? If so, then it is on the high side and should be repeated.   If you do have diabetes(or a milder case of abnormal glucose) it may be because of your weight. Dietary changes and exercise  to help shed some pounds should help improve the glucose problem. It can be difficult dealing with many stresses at once, and often people do eat more than usual due to stress and depression. Perhaps you can also speak with your doctor about your anxiety and see if couselling can help too.Best of luck and take care of yourself.

question: Hi Dr. thanks for your time to help others, I have my test done and my glocose was 124. I am 15 pounds over weight, I never have my sugar test that high, the Dr. send to repeat it and to do a glycohemoglobin test.  Would that be a possibility of a pre diabetis? or just because I am overweight.  I just turned 56 yrs. and also my anion gap was low 3.0 and the chororide was 111, and the osmolality was 289.8.  Please help to clear these worries of my mind.  I usually eat healthy, I am eating even more healthy.  I gain weight when my mother die, because a lot of anxiety.thanks very much for your kindness.
title: glucose increase in my tests
